name: Euclidean space
summary: Euclidean space is a flat, geometric space that follows the axioms of Euclidean geometry, where the "flatness" means parallel lines never meet and the angles of a triangle always sum to 180 degrees. It can exist in any number of dimensions, denoted as \(R^{n}\), where n is the dimension. For example, \(R^{1}\) is a line, \(R^{2}\) is a plane, and \(R^{3}\) is the three-dimensional space we experience.
